content.description: Start low with your left-hand low in the crack and right hand around the corner and feet on the smaller rocks under the main boulder. Move your right hand to the jug and bring your feet up. Move your left hand to the same jug. The crux is moving from the jug to the hold on the top edge. Make the move and top out. It's a little sharp in places but I cleaned most of the choss off.
content.location: Find Union boulder. Looking at the boulder's highest face, the route is on the left corner, obvious verticle crack with a nice jug.

content.description: A pretty square boulder with a sloping top. Approximately 13 feet at its tallest point. Two very nice routes in its two tallest corners. Flat, level, and soft ground for landing. Very close to the trailhead parking.
